page.title: 17RHYMNEY STATION-TRANSPORT
page.content: Rhymney station is situated at the top end of the Rhymney Valley, 24 miles from Cardiff. It is also a train crew depot, drivers and guards booking on at various times 0f the day to work trains to Cardiff, Penarth and Barry Island. Overnight there are 4 diesel multiple units stabled, with a driver in charge,in preparation for the next day's work. The complement of staff is as follows;14 drivers,24 guards,2 leading railmen,1 carriage cleaner,3 chargemen, 1 traffic assistant. Rhymney depot wor ks only Passenger Trains since 1970. Prior to this there was a consider- able number of coal trains worked,but this ceased when the Rhymney Valley collieries closed.
